programme.title: Christmas in the Smokies
programme.desc: Clinging to the only life she's ever known, a headstrong woman (along with her loving parents) finds herself on the verge of losing her family's berry farm in the heart of the Smoky Mountains, to an impending retail expansion. Over one eventful holiday season, she tries every avenue possible to save the farm. But, when the local town leaders notify her that they will have to seize the property after the holidays, her last hope to unite the town, is to throw a Christmas concert on the farm, headlined by her former love, a ne'er-do-well country music superstar. As the day of the concert approaches, they all must learn the value of family, faith and community—before time runs out.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Within a baby's first year of life, new experiences can transform what might otherwise seem to be ordinary events into exciting opportunities for imaginative play. Baby Neptune exposes little ones to the wonders of water in their world -- whether they're stomping in the rain, splashing in the bathtub, playing "catch me if you can" with the tide on the beach, or "meeting" the fascinating creatures that live in rivers, lakes and oceans.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: World Music introduces you and your little one to beautiful sounds from every continent, bringing a fresh, new experience of music and culture. Sing, dance and play to exotic rhythms that open the door to an appreciation of different cultures from around the world.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Your little one will want to keep a beat, snap his fingers and march his feet! Join new characters Pillie, the musical woodpecker, and Coco, the dancing cockatoo, and share the excitement of rhythm with your baby. World of Rhythm explores rhythm in music, rhythm in nature and rhythm as a form of expression.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Sharing the joys and traditions of the holiday season with your little one is truly one of the greatest gifts of parenthood, and Baby Santa's Music Box makes this magical time even more special! Celebrate by treating your baby and yourself to a captivating wonderland of bright lights, sparkling ornaments, sleigh bells, toys, winter scenes, jolly Santas and more -- all accompanied by beloved holiday melodies.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Early on in babies' development, they begin to recognize primary colors such as blue, red, and yellow. And all the while, they're also processing an infinite variety of new sights and sounds. Think of the joy you'll experience as you introduce your little one to beautiful music and imagery with Baby Beethoven Symphony of Fun.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: One of the greatest joys you'll ever experience is bonding with your baby during those calm, quiet moments. Lullaby Time: Soothing Sounds for Baby provides comforting sights and sounds as you relax and share this precious downtime.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: At 12 months, babies can identify specific sounds, and they re also starting to match the sounds they hear with the objects that make them. Meet the Orchestra -- First Instruments presents your little "maestro" with a playful introduction to the sights and sounds of a real orchestra -- from the clashing of cymbals to the purring of the cello and everything in between!

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: As their communication skills continue to develop, little ones begin to recognize common words and may point to objects or pictures when these items are named. Baby Wordsworth playfully taps into your little one's natural curiosity and introduces 30 words from around the home -- both spoken and in sign language. This engaging program presents little ones with familiar objects in the kitchen, playroom, yard and more -- from the living room window to their favorite teddy bear.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Baby's innate curiosity about all they see and hear increases on a daily basis. Before long, they begin to associate words with objects and to imitate and articulate sounds. Why not give their eyes and ears something wonderful to feast upon? Baby Shakespeare presents little ones with 12 common words that can be found within the rich context of classic poems and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: Join our playful puppet host, Bard the Dragon, on a fun-filled adventure using everyday words such as flower, cat, and moon, and beautiful scenery from nature. World Of Words lets you and your little one share the excitement of discovering new words together!

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: As babies turn one year old, they continue to develop their communication skills. Meanwhile, with you as their guide, they also begin to explore the world beyond their front door. Baby's Favorite Places presents them with a playful introduction to 20 words for the names of familiar locations from the market, to the library, to the local park.

programme.title: Baby Einstein
programme.desc: As little ones become better acquainted with the world, they grow curious about animals of all kinds, beyond just the family pet. And as their communication skills continue to develop, they enjoy imitating animal sounds as well. Baby Noah Animal Expedition takes your little explorer across the globe to meet animals -- two-by-two -- from the savannah, the rainforest and tropics, the Outback, the ocean and the Polar Regions.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies stand in Teletubbyland in a line. A Voice Trumpet appears and tells Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po to swap places with one another. The Teletubbies giggle as they swap. They end up in different places in the line. The Voice...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa are following a trail of muddy footprints. The footprints lead into Home Dome. The Teletubbies follow the muddy footprints inside - all the way up to Po's bed. Po is in bed with very muddy feet! The Noo-noo is on...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: It's very cold in Teletubbyland and the Teletubbies are outside. The Tiddlytubbies are nice and warm inside. The Teletubbies wave to the Tiddlytubbies through the window and then run off for Tummy Tales. Two brothers play outside in the snow in...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies wave "Eh-oh." The Windmill starts spinning. It is time for Tummy Tales. In Tummy Tales, a girl puts on a party hat ready for her brother's first birthday party. She and her family play a game of pass the parcel and her brother...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky is inside Home Dome and says "Eh-oh." Tinky Winky sees a green, glittery trail on the ground beside him, so he follows it and finds that it leads to... Dipsy! Together they notice two more trails, one red and one yellow, so they follow...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy and Laa-Laa are taking turns to run around in circles in Teletubbyland. Dipsy runs in a circle around Laa-Laa. Again Again! This time, Dipsy runs in the other direction. Then it is Laa-Laa's turn to run in a circle around Dipsy. Laa-Laa runs...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: In Teletubbyland, the Teletubbies are 'bottom bumping'. They have lots of fun 'bottom bumping' into each other and then bumping on to the ground. The Windmill starts to spin and they run off for the start of Tummy Tales. In Tummy Tales, children...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: In Teletubbyland, the Teletubbies practise dancing a special dance called Flamenco. Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-Laa and Po each perform their own Flamenco routine. The Windmill spins and they're off, running to get ready for Tummy Tales. The children...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: It is Songtime in Teletubbyland. The Teletubbies rush over to see the Tiddlytubbies and sing The Tiddlytubbies' Song. The Teletubbies hear the sound of the Windmill so they run off for Tummy Tales. The children in Tummy Tales learn an African song...

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies want to go to sleep, but Tinky Winky finds Po already asleep in his bed. So he goes to look for somewhere else to sleep.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch some children learn about the number three. Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa go for a walk. They count three trees and three flowers and Po follows behind counting too.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies are asleep when a voice trumpet appears singing the rhyme 'Frére Jacques'. The Teletubbies laugh and call "Again, again!"

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies see a little girl and her brother who love salad. They go shopping in a market a market with their grandma to buy some salad to eat.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch two boys make Chinese Lanterns with their uncle. In Teletubbyland, it is time for Tubby Toast, but where has Laa-Laa's toast gone?

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Ryan decides that he wants to act and look just like Barney. Barney tells the kids a Native American story that teaches to be yourself and not follow to the crowd.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney teaches Baby Bop the importance of following the rules when playing games with friends. Baby Bop is frustrated about hearing "No" all the time.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney tells Ryan a story about how a boy became emperor by being honest. After BJ takes credit for Sarah's painting, Barney teaches him to always be honest with his friends.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Baby Bop tries to convince to BJ and Riff that she had seen an elephant in the park. Barney introduces Riff of the best deaf musicians of all time - Beethoven.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Anger is an emotion that every child experiences, and on this particular day it seems that everyone in Barney's world is mad. Barney encourages all of his young friends to find good ways to express and deal with their angry moments-like talking about angry feelings, pounding on clay, and crossing their arms and shouting, "I'm mad!" A play about "Goldilocks and The Three Bears" helps BJ and Baby Bop to calm down after their heated sibling confrontation.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Every day with Barney is fun-but today is stuuu-PENDously special: it's Barney's birthday! His friends decide to throw a party and BJ and Baby Bop arrive with party supplies to help prepare for the festivities. Jackson is inspired by their assortment of handmade presents and hurries home in search of a very "special" gift for Barney. While waiting for his return, they play party games, sing songs and open presents.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney and the children spend the day preparing for a performance for their friends in the park. BJ has trouble deciding what talent he'll perform in the show, but when he's reminded to just be himself, he discovers a talent that rocks the park!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Happy, sad, or mad, Barney and his friends discover that feelings aren't bad. The children have fun making masks to show what they're feeling on the inside. While Baby Bop and BJ learn how to talk about their feelings after an argument. Everyone finds their feelings change while singing, dancing, exercising, and being with friends.

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: A special project provides the perfect opportunity for Barney, Baby Bop and BJ to learn about love and relationships the "heart" way as they make a "Friends and Family Tree." Songs and games provide a fun way to remind them that playing together, being helpful and showing kindness are all ways of being nice to those we love and care about. With Barney's help, Baby Bop and BJ discover there are many people we love and care for and who care for us!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Barney brings the music! Making their own musical instruments, Barney and his friends enjoy the thrill of becoming a real marching band! They learn about many different instruments that bring music to your ears!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: "Simon Says" Barney has a fun time playing with the children in the park. As Baby Bop, BJ, and the children learn ways to move their bodies through dancing, playing games, and acting out "The Tortoise and the Hare." Get moving and grooving with Barney and his friends!

programme.title: Barney and Friends
programme.desc: Imagine that! After Laura draws a special picture, Barney and his friends use their imaginations to bring her picture to life. A treasure trove of fun is shared on their stu-u-pendous island adventure.

programme.desc: Bob is rendering a wall for Mr Sabatini. / After a stormy night Wendy has to mend a chimney pot at Mrs Potts'.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is building a water feature in Mrs Potts' garden. / Wendy is making a floral display for the town square.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It is Wendy's birthday, but she doesn't want any fuss. / The town is practicing for an egg and spoon race.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is repairing a leaking water tank at school. / Bob is installing an antique fireplace for Mrs Percival.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Farmer Pickles wants a fence built around his compost heap. / Bob is replacing a potting shed for Mr Beasley.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is demolishing an old house. Farmer Pickles needs a fence built to keep the rabbits out.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is building a new exercise park. Farmer Pickles has decided to open a camp site on his land.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The Mayor asks Bob to build a Pets Corner in a local park. / A burst pipe outside Mr Sabatini's needs fixing.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is making a through-lounge at the Bentleys'. / Mr Fothergill has a nasty case of dry rot.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and team are building a barn for Farmer Pickles. / Farmer Pickles wants to open a camp site on his land.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Blueberry has become obsessed with the mystery book detective heroine, Patti Persimmon. She decorates her store with Patti posters and rearranges her shelves to make room for all the Patti books she's ordered. Blueberry begins to neglect outings with her friends and even goes so far as to dress like her idol just to emulate her. She then starts looking for cases to solve around town.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While in the midst of a cake decorating demonstration at the café, the girls are uncharacteristically interrupted by an excited Princess Berrykin. She announces the Berrykins have decided to revive the old tradition of the Berry Bitty Buggy Derby. While the girls enthusiastically recount the stories they've heard about it and ask the Princess questions, Blueberry, carrying enough books to block her view, comes through the door and unknowingly interrupts the Princess.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: The grove around Berry Bitty City is abuzz with activity. The Berrykins are using their sparkles to harvest berries, Berrykin Bloom is in his garden spraying flowers with a special solution to make them larger, and Raspberry is nearby gathering flower petals to make perfume. The wind starts to blow and picks up some of the sparkles. The sparkles float along the wind and get combined with some of Berrykin Bloom's solution.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: It's time again for the Dance-Off between the Big Bitty City Dance Team and the Berry Bitty City Dancers. Plum is stressed out and frazzled because she desperately wants to win. And the Big Bitty City Dancers are a force to be reckoned with. They are elegant and beautifully synchronized. Plum shows the girls a maze of dance steps that she's choreographed in the hopes of creating a winning piece. The problem is, the contest is only 1 week away!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Raspberry is distraught when she suspects her friends have copied her design on her lantern for the "Glimmerberry Gathering".

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While sipping cider in Strawberry's café, the girls muse about how they cannot wait for winter to arrive. They list the various traditions they love about the season but the one they all agree on is the Glimmerberry Ball. Strawberry mentions that she doesn't think the café can hold the party this year because of how the town has grown. The girls decide to split up and search for a new location.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Lemon is ecstatic. She races out of her salon and goes around to the other girls' houses proclaiming that she "did it!" and beckoning them to join her. They follow her back and are completely dazzled by her newest creation - Glamicures. They are brightly colored, jeweled manicures with tiny microchips inside that play songs when the wearer moves her hand. Each girl lines up to receive her new glamicure and soon there is a cacophony of color and sound.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: While working in her store, Orange overhears the Berrykins laughing and shouting outside. When she goes to the door to investigate, a clump of dandelion fluff gets blown inside chased by three Berrykins. She watches as they head butt the clump around until it floats back toward Orange. Just as it floats close, she gives it a bat sending it outside and the Berrykins happily chasing after it. Wanting in on the fun, she joins them.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: With all the Baby Berrykins running around Berry Bitty City, Princess Berrykin decides to build a Day Care Center and playground. But she's worried because it's dull-looking - all grey metal and brown wood. She asks Strawberry whom might be good to help her out. And two names immediately come to her mind - Lemon and Raspberry! The Princess confesses she's always admired their sense of design and style.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: With only a few days of summer left, the girls are about to enjoy their first vacation in their newly-created, tropical beach resort at Berry Bitty Lake, when who should descend upon them but Mavis Maraschino, the comically over-the-top "Entertainment Tonight"-style show host. Mavis has dumped her focus on fashions in favor of an even glitzier show called Lifestyles of the Berry Big Bitty Stars, and she wants her first segment to be about how pop superstar Cherry Jam spends her vacation.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: On a beautiful winter's night, Blueberry reads the Baby Berrykins a story of what happened one winter in Berry Bitty City-a winter that almost wasn't. Just as everyone is ready for winter fun and fashions, a sudden warming melts the snow and ruins their plans. Improvising with snowmen made of shaved ice and cotton puffs, Strawberry and her friends play "Capture the Snowman's Carrot Nose." The Berrykins want to join in the fun, so the girls play against them, with Strawberry refereeing.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: It's another windy winter day, and the postal bees are staying indoors-the wind is too strong for their berry bitty wings. "We don't know when the next mail will get through!" It's bad news for Blueberry, who has been anxiously awaiting the next installment of a Patty Persimmon Detective story. If only she could get to the post office in Berry Bitty Dale where her package is waiting!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: It appears winter is finally coming to an end and Raspberry is planning a big fashion show to display her spring line. Her vision is to have the girls model her fashions in a parade past the town fountain. What she didn't realize is that the Berrykins are turning the fountain into a big water show. Every time the girls come to rehearse, they must comically dodge jets of fruit juice from the out-of-control fountain-the Berrykins are still working out the bugs.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcake
programme.desc: Strawberry, Cherry and the girls form a new band, Strawberry and the Sweet Beats, and prepare to go on the road to perform at the Opening Ceremony of the Berry Big City Games! While master mechanic Berrykin Bruce turns Cherry's tour bus into the band's hotel-on-wheels, Strawberry and her friends pack for the big trip. But the rest of Berry Bitty City points out that someone needs to run the girls' businesses while they are gone.

programme.title: The Sharksons
programme.desc: Meet the Sharksons - an adorable family of sharks who love to sing, explore, dance and play.

programme.title: KiiYii
programme.sub-title: KiiYii and Friends Have a Fun Winter
programme.desc: Join Kii and Yii on their action-packed adventures round the magical playmat.

programme.title: Little Angel
programme.sub-title: Cozy Winter Times with Little Angel
programme.desc: Come sing along with baby John, his brother, Jack, and sister, Jill in Little Angel!

programme.title: Little Baby Bum
programme.sub-title: Little Baby Bum Loves Winter With Family
programme.desc: Join Mia, Twinkle the Star and Baby Max for some of your favourite nursery rhymes!

programme.title: Morphle Classics
programme.sub-title: Winter Time with Morphle and the Family
programme.desc: No matter what the town needs, Mila and her magical pet, Morphle will work together to save the day.

programme.title: Gecko's Garage
programme.desc: Gecko's Garage is a repair shop that cares! Run by cheerful mechanic Gecko, his trusty robot sidekicks.

programme.title: Little Angel
programme.sub-title: A Happy Christmas With Little Angel
programme.desc: Come sing along with baby John, his brother, Jack, and sister, Jill in Little Angel!

programme.title: Oddbods
programme.desc: Follow the wacky of adventures of the Oddbods in Oddsville!

programme.title: Playtime With Twinkle
programme.sub-title: Twinkle Spends Time with Friends This Winter
programme.desc: Join Twinkle and sing along to your favourite lullabies.

programme.title: Morphle Classics
programme.desc: No matter what the town needs, Mila and her magical pet, Morphle will work together to save the day.

programme.title: Oddbods
programme.desc: Follow the wacky of adventures of the Oddbods in Oddsville!

programme.title: Lellobee City Farm
programme.sub-title: A Cold Cozy Christmas On the Farm
programme.desc: With singing veggies, plants and farm animals, you've been invited to Lellobee City Farm!

programme.title: Morphle
programme.desc: No matter what the town needs, Mila and her magical pet, Morphle will work together to save the day.

programme.title: Oddbods
programme.sub-title: Oddbods The Shame The Blame and the Fame
programme.desc: Follow the wacky of adventures of the Oddbods in Oddsville!

programme.title: Ryan's World
programme.desc: Gus the Gummy Gator and his Ryan's World friends go on learning adventures through the cartoon and IRL worlds!

programme.title: Toys and Colors
programme.desc: Toys and Colors teaches kids life skills, letters, numbers, and more – all in a fun and family-friendly way!

programme.title: Ryan's World
programme.desc: Ryan and the gang explore the world and discover wacky fun with familiar faces and brand new places!

programme.title: Jason Vlogs
programme.desc: Jason and Alex hit the road! The brothers visit a kids museum, the zoo, get their eyesight checked and more.

programme.title: Ryan's World
programme.desc: Kid video superstar Ryan and his Ryan's World pals take you along on all their awesome learning adventures!

programme.title: Ryan's World
programme.desc: Animals everywhere! Ryan meets cool kid-friendly pets, Gus the Gummy Gators wrangles zoo animals, and more.

programme.title: Jason Vlogs
programme.desc: Pull on your knee pads! Jason and Alex learn the importance of safety, plus even more fun lessons for kids.

programme.title: The Grand Hotel
programme.desc: The five friends help out at The Grand Hotel that Andrea's family just bought during what was supposed to be a quiet weekend until a hotel critic arrives unexpectedly. The girls are ready to do everything to make a great impression – but things don't quite go according to plan. Andrea, Stephanie, Olivia, Emma and Mia have come for breakfast at the fanciest hotel in town, now owned by Andrea's family. When Andrea's aunt has to leave town, the girls volunteer to run the hotel for the weekend with the help of quirky Grandma Jean. This is the perfect job for Stephanie's expert managerial skills but then the hotel suddenly fills to capacity with guests, including a hotel critic that can make or break the hotel's reputation! Now the girls find themselves in over their heads juggling reception, childcare, food prep and waitressing, a dog-walking service and a testy chef who quits on them in the middle of dinner. Unfortunately, much of this is their own fault. Can the girls save the Grand Hotel from themselves?

programme.title: All Of Nothing
programme.desc: The ninja and Sensei Wu try to infiltrate the Serpentines' inner sanctum and walk right into a trap, and when Lloyd's rescue mission fails, there is only one person who can help them, namely the evil Lord Garmadon – but can they trust him?

programme.title: The Might And The Magic
programme.desc: Aaron races across the kingdom to gather the NEXO-Knights as Jestro and his Destructive Monsters attack the King's Castle. The Knights must get back to the capitol in time, or Jestro will rule the kingdom! Jestro, while still attacking the King's Castle, has second thoughts until the Book of Monsters orders the mad jester to feed him another magic book he's found (and has been saving.) It's the powerful “Book of Revenge!” Now, combining the powers of Revenge and Destruction, Jestro and his monsters will get their vengeance on King Halbert and the Kingdom of Knighton. Jestro and his monsters lay siege…will they destroy the castle?! Meanwhile, Aaron races across the Kingdom gathering the NEXO-Knights one at a time. As each Knight rejoins the group, they become a more and more powerful team. They even get Robin to join them as the Black Knight in his repaired power suit. Our Knights arrive, finally regrouped, fight off Jestro, save the castle and the King. It's a glorious victory! The King is so pleased after seeing how the brave NEXO-Knights saved his kingdom, he allows Macy to join them as an official NEXO-Knight.

programme.title: The Rise Of The Great Devourer
programme.desc: The ninja haste to the lost city of Ouroboros to try to stop Pythor from awaking The Great Devourer but it is a race against time.

programme.title: Back To School
programme.desc: When the NEXO-Knights are sloppy in a fight with Jestro, Merlok 2.0 sends them back to the Knights' Academy. Not only for a brush-up but to find out what Jestro is after in its hallowed halls. As they Knights battle Jestro – in a somewhat haphazard and lazy way – they discuss the fact that Jestro never wins and that they're always getting over on him. Despite defeating the jerky Jester and his evil Book, Merlok 2.0 discovers that something about the attack on the village is tied to the Knights' Academy. It looks like that's where they'll strike next. It wouldn't hurt for the Knights to go “back to school” to watch for Jestro and for some refresher training. Merlok is sure Jestro wants something at the Academy, but he doesn't know what it is. The Knights are very much “fish out of water” at the academy, even with the “cool kids” – Robin and Ava – showing them around. The next generation of Knights is being taught to integrate the NEXO-Magic of Merlok into their fighting techniques and these kids are good (so good, they initially kick the lazy, know-it-all Knight's butts!) Their old principal, the ever-ornery Headmaster Brickland, sets them straight: they're all still slackers, and they better get their acts together (especially Lance!) The Knights take shifts as “library helpers” much to the delight of the old squirebot librarian, MARGE. They're convinced Jestro is after a book…isn't he always after a book? When Jestro attacks, the Knights help organize the students and there's a big fight in the Academy Library versus Jestro and his Monsters. They drive Jestro off without letting him steal any books! Victory! But as Jestro leaves, we see him holding what the Book of Monsters really wanted: a snow globe with a castle in it that was sitting on the librarian's desk. In the Lava Lands, Jestro throws the snow globe into a volcano and it frees the massive Castle of Monstrux from its snowy magic prison

programme.title: Getting Tthe Message
programme.desc: As the Friends enjoy Heartlake Amusement Park, Emma types a text to Mia, but sends it to Matthew by mistake a text that could be mega-embarrassing for Emma! As her BFF's, the Friends race to find Matthew's phone and erase the text before he reads it. But first, they must brave space rides, dunking booths and worse: the boys locker room! What's more frightening than a roller coaster? Moretwisted than a funhouse mirror? A text gone wrong! TheFriends' fun day at Heartlake Amusement Park turns into afrantic race against time when Emma discovers that herinnocent text to Mia was sent to Matthew by mistake -- atext that accidentally sounds like a pledge of Emma'sundying love for Matthew! Mega-embarrassing! As Emma'sBFF's, the Friends must scramble to retrieve Matthew'sphone and erase the text before he reads it. But first,they need to brave space rides, dunking booths, an angrybrute and worse - the boys locker room!

programme.title: Day Of The Great Devourer
programme.desc: Disaster threatens as the ninja must fight to defeat the all consuming Great Devourer in a desperate attempt to save Ninjago.

programme.title: Greed Is Good?
programme.desc: When Jestro uses the Book of Greed to rob Auremville of its riches, he also gets Lance's parents as prisoners and these demanding rich folks are too much for even monsters to handle. Jestro's not sure what to do with his new castle in the Lava Lands. “Every castle needs a big chamber filled with treasure” says the Book of Monsters so they've got to go out looting! The BOM convinces Jestro to call forth GENERAL MAGMAR, and Jestro appoints him as “general manager” of “castle operations,” much to Magmar's dismay. Meanwhile, Jestro and the BOM find the BOOK OF GREED. This will allow them to make greedy, rapacious monsters that will bring them all the treasure they want to fill their castle! They'll head to the richest town in the realm – AUREMVILLE! Meanwhile, in Auremville, the NEXO-Knights arrive for a huge “Gold is Good” ball at Lance's house. When the Monsters finally arrive in Auremville, a battle breaks out and the greedy monsters make off with everything…including Lance's parents, Goldie and Cuthbert Richmond who are clad in the finest golden garments and so look valuable! Lance will now be forced to live…poor. The Knights have to get his parents back. Meanwhile, his parents – Cuthbert and Goldie Richmond –think their imprisonment in Jestro's gold-filled castle is a “spa holiday” with the worst service. They order Magmar and the monsters around like servants and drive them all crazy. The Knights pile into the Fortrex and head for the Lava Lands, formulating a plan along the way to free Lance's parents. In a village half-way to Jestro's Castle, the Knights run into…Jestro and his monsters headed the other way with Lance's parents and all the gold they've stolen. There's a big fight, until they realize they might have the same goal and decide to deal. The BOM wants to give them back all the gold and Lance's parents. Lance says “No deal.” “We'll take the gold, you can keep my parents.” It's a weird and comical stand-off. Finally, Clay convinces Lance he has to take his parents back even if they don't always get along (and, it's the only way to get the gold back.)

programme.title: Darkness Shall Rise
programme.desc: Just as the rebuilding effort in Ninjago begins, the four ninjas come to realize that evil has started to resurface with Lord Garmadon forging the ninjas' lost Golden Weapons into a Mega-Weapon with unspeakable powers.With the Devourer destroyed, Ninjago is saved and the rebuilding effort begins. Without their Golden Weapons, the Ninja are stripped of their elemental powers. And with their flying ship ‘The Destiny's Bounty' destroyed, the Ninja are forced to find a new home in the city. Meanwhile, Lord Garmadon resurfaces and gains control of the Serpentine as well as transforms the Bounty's wreckage to become ‘The Black Bounty'. The Ninja will battle Scales and discover evil has begun to resurface in Ninjago, while Lord Garmadon will successfully forge the Golden Weapons into a Mega-Weapon with unspeakable powers.

programme.title: The Book Of Obsession
programme.desc: The Knights are tasked with protecting the King's valuable Ned Knights comic book during the Bookingheim Knight-a-Con. But with all the costumed kids there, will they recognize the real Jestro and Book of Monsters coming to get them? King Halbert instructs the Knights that they must take his valuable Ned Knights comic book to the “Knight-a-Kon” in Bookingham. It will be the first be first prize at the Knight-a-Kon. But the Book of Monsters wants the book, too. Having devoured Ned Knightly comic books in it's down time it has become fanatically obsessed with the storyline. General Magmar suggests they simply attack the place and take what they want, but Jestro tells them they can't: everyone will be in costume and they'll be thousands of comics there. This calls for a clever “infiltration” mission (which will also allow Jestro to see the Kon, which he's always wanted to do.) So Jestro goes into the Kon with the BOM and some monsters. And it's easy because everyone is in costume Jestro, the BOM and their monsters fit right in at the convention and Clay and crew have their work cut out for them trying to separate fiend from fan. Macy keeps going on-and-on about the story in the King's comic book as the Knights keep a watchful eye on it. Robin even shows up in the “Minitrex” – a small version of the Fortrex he built just for the Knight-a-Kon. He's convinced he can win the costume competition that is the big closing event for the Kon. At the end of the Kon there's a big awards ceremony for “Best Costume.” The prize: “Ned Knightly, Knight of Knighton, Issue #1.” The BOM must get it and scheme to get closer to it during the costume contest. He's just…about…to get the book when…the impatient Magmar attacks! Everyone thinks it's part of the big show! “Ned Knightly, Knight of Knighton, Issue #1” is tossed from person-to-person-to-person in the melee. The Knights must do something, but they're too far away from the Fortrex to download any NEXO-Power. Robin pulls up in his Minitrex they can use it to get NEXO-Power! Robin wins the best costume for his Minitrex and wins the Ned Knightly Comic which he then gives to Macy…she deserves to read it.

programme.title: The Drooling Detective
programme.desc: When ruthless dognappers steal Mia's dog Toffee from the Heartlake City Dog Talent Show, it's up to the Friends to play detective and track down the culprits, with the help of an unlikely hero: Stephanie's borrowed sad-sack bloodhound, Benchley. Andrea and her singing dog act, the Howlers, are a sure bet to win the Heartlake City Dog Talent Show – in spite of stiff competition from Tanya's dancing poodle, Olivia's Robo-Dog, and even Stephanie's sad-sack borrowed bloodhound, Benchley. But when an unscrupulous mother-and-son dog-napping team steals the Howlers' best singer, Mia's dog Toffee, it's up to the Friends to rescue him and catch the baddies with the help of the Hero Of The Day – Benchley!

programme.title: Pirates Vs. Ninja
programme.desc: When Garmadon by accident brings to life the original owners of the Black Bounty – the ruthless Captain Soto and his Pirates - it is up to our ninjas to stop them from plundering Ninjago City. Sharing a tiny, one-bedroom apartment in the city, the Ninja take Lloyd to Grand Sensei Darreth's Mojo Dojo to begin training. There, they discover Lloyd has all four of their natural elemental abilities. Meanwhile, Lord Garmadon discovers his Mega-Weapon can't destroy, only create what the user wishes. By accident, Garmadon brings to life the original owners of the Black Bounty: Captain Soto and his Pirates, and they mutiny the ship. Answering the age-old question of who would win a fight between pirates and ninja, it's up to our ninja to stop Captain Soto and his men from plundering Ninjago City. In the end, Ninjago City is saved, the Pirates are arrested and Lord Garmadon escapes once again with their Black Bounty.

programme.title: The King's Tournament
programme.desc: Rival to the King, Jorah Tightwad thinks his knights – the Tighty Knighties – are easily better than the NEXO-Knights, so he challenges King Halbert to prove who's better during the King's Birthday Tournament. It's the King's birthday! To celebrate, the Queen and Macy always throw him a great, big birthday party consisting of a feast on birthday eve and a tournament the next day. At the birthday banquet is JORAH TIGHTWAD (last seen in episode 104.) He's goading the King (and on his birthday, even) and going on and on about how his knights are better than the NEXO-Knights. The King protests, but Jorah asks “How many magical books have your knights recovered? None, zilch, zero.” But he produces the BOOK OF ENVY, which his superior knights captured from Jestro. The next day, the NEXO-Knights square off against Tightwad's four knights: JOUSTING BEEBER, BRICKNEY SPEARS, SHIA LABLADE and THE BLOK. We see that all these knights are envious of the NEXO-Knights: their weapons, their fame, their hair, etc. Macy is also disappointed to find out she CAN'T fight in the tournament – she's agreed to be in “princess mode” for her father's birthday. During the tournament, we see that Tightwad's knights are amazing in fighting contests. They all pair-off with knights who have their same weapons skills. Tightwad makes fun of the NEXO-Knights as his knights do well. Jestro and the Book of Monsters discover that Tightwad has the Book of Envy and he and his monsters attack the tournament. Then we learn that Tightwad's knights might be good tournament fighters, but they can't handle real fights and the NEXO-Knights must save them! Macy is finally able to join in the fight when she sees Magmar show up on the flank. The NEXO-Knights successfully defend the king, but Jestro gets away with the Book of Envy. Tightwad must admit his knights never won the book from Jestro he got the book when Merlok blasted books of magic across the realm. Tightwad's knights all admit that they really admire the NEXO-Knights.

programme.title: Rabbitouille
programme.desc: It's Stephanie vs. Tanya on a TV Bake-Off to end all bake-offs! Stephanie concocts a fabulous cake, and Sneaky Tanya steals the recipe -- but neither knows that pet bunny Daisy has added a secret key ingredient. Will Stephanie's frantic efforts to win at all costs end her friendship with her BFF's? It's Stephanie vs. Tanya on a TV Bake-Off to end all bake-offs! After the duo's rivalry brings Aunt Sophie's Adopt-A-Pet Fair to a disastrous end, a contrite Stephanie wants to make amends with the prize money from a TV Bake-Off show. At home, Stephanie practices baking a delicious cake, and Tanya steals the recipe. But neither girl knows that Stephanie's pet bunny has inadvertently added a secret ingredient, ensuring that no one can repeat the recipe. A frustrated Stephanie freaks out, nearly ending her friendship with the girls – until they discover the bunny's secret and race to help Stephanie win.

programme.title: Double Trouble
programme.desc: When our heroes are invited back to Darkly's Boarding School, they discover it's a trap set up by Lord Garmadon and his evil replica ninjas created by Garmadon's new Mega-Weapo. Realizing how to correctly wield the Mega-Weapon, Lord Garmadon creates evil replicas of the Ninja to face off with our heroes. Meanwhile, Lloyd and the Ninja are invited back the Darkly's Boarding School, only to discover it's a trap and now the bad kids have seized control of the school. With the Ninja trapped in the school with the faculty, things spiral out of control as the Evil Replica Ninja arrive. As an awesome battle takes place in the school halls, the Ninja manage to outsmart their evil versions, and warn Lord Garmadon they're ready for whatever else he throws at them.

programme.title: Monster Chef
programme.desc: Axl and Chef Éclair must enter a cooking contest to try to keep Jestro from getting the hottest chili recipe in the realm. Knighton celebrity chef GOBBLETON RAMBLEY announces that he's developed the hottest chili recipe ever created. Now, he intends to give the recipe to the winner of his “Hottest Chili Cook-Off Competition” cooking show on Knighton TV. He'll turn over his famous Chili Cookbook with the hottest chili recipe on the last page. It's so unique it can't be recreated without it. Jestro and the Book of Monsters think they MUST have that recipe. “Hot chili makes hot monsters!” Merlok knows that this recipe, in the wrong hands – meaning Jestro's – could be dangerous. But when the Knights appeal to the egomaniacal chef, he says the only way to get the recipe is to win it from him. So Axl and Chef Éclair decide to enter. The team that creates the hottest chili will win Rambley's cookbook. Chef Éclair is unsure that Axl has the skills to help them win the competition, but, as we see through funny cooking show bits, Axl is quite good and they become a pretty good team. (We will also learn that years ago, Rambley stole one of Éclair's best recipes and they don't like each other.) While watching the multi-part competition, Aaron and Lance have a contest of their own: who can eat the hottest chili. Axl and Éclair actually win the competition, coming up with a raging hot chili recipe. Before they can claim their prize, Jestro and his monsters attack with Magmar leading the way on his siege tower. They must get that cookbook! During the battle, Rambley's cookbook is accidentally melted. After the battle, Rambley announces his new quest: to make the sweetest ice cream ever! While Axl and Éclair cook happily in the kitchen of the Fortrex, back in the Redoubt of Ruination, Jestro and Lavaria are attempting to recreate Rambley's chili recipe. They keep spooning various recipes of chili into the Book of Monsters. “Nope, not hot enough…waaaay too much garlic….you call that hot?!” (BELCH!)

programme.title: Change Of Address
programme.desc: When Stephanie's mom leaves her in charge of their house for a few days, it's finally Stephanie's chance to prove she can handle responsibility alone. Naturally, everything that can go wrong does go wrong – especially when the entire house disappears! When Stephanie's mom leaves her in charge of their house for a few days, it's finally Stephanie's chance to prove she can handle responsibility alone. But after fending off Andrea's party plans, a Home Alone-style break-in (by the hapless Snivel, trying to retrieve incriminating evidence of the Mayor's latest scheme), and finally the entire house disappearing (“Uh, think Stephanie's Mom will notice?”), Stephanie comes to appreciate that responsibility is a lot harder than it looks.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic and the Freedom Fighters journey to Robotnik's lab in hopes of deciphering his roboti-sizer system. While underground, Sonic spots his now roboti-sized Uncle Chuck aboard a Badlands bound mine-train and devises a plan for his rescue.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sally, Rotor, Bunnie and Antoine take off in a homemade airplane, bound for an ancient city hidden deep in the Great Mountains, while Sonic follows via his favorite transportation, his sneakers.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic is hired into an obvious trap when a frustrated Robotnik decides to appeal to the Hedgehog's ego and announces a "race to determine the fastest on Mobius".

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: Sonic conquers Robotnik's latest evil - a vehicle designated to locate and destroy living tissue matter - during a solo mission to the Badlands. Upon Sonic's return, the Freedom Fighters honor him with a victory party.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: When Robotnik launches a spy-orb that will uncover the Freedom Fighter's Knothole location, Sonic and Robot launch themselves up to the orbiting spy-sphere aboard a home-made rocket powered by Robotnik's discarded booster engine.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: Robotnik announces that he will marry Queen Aleena in a plot to become the king of Mobius.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: A captain of the Queen's guard is captured before he can reach the secret rendezvous where he was to meet Queen Aleena.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: A homecoming is interrupted for Sonic, Sonia and Manic when Sleet and Dingo arrive to collect back taxes after returning to their birthplace.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: Sonia discovers that the watch she received from her friend is actually a monitoring device for the Robotnik Intelligence Agency.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: Sleet and Dingo plan to collect the taxes owed to Robotnik from the Duke of Velcronia but keep it for themselves.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: The sinister Robotnik blackmails Cyrus, an old friend of Sonic's, by holding his father hostage.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: On a trip to Port Mobius, Sonic, Manic and Sonia are told that ships are sinking due to the Mobian sea-beast.

programme.title: Sonic Underground
programme.desc: Rumor has it that Queen Aleena's journals are buried in the city of Tashistan. Sonic and his siblings search the city for the scrolls.

programme.title: Sonic the Hedgehog
programme.desc: During a mission to one of Robotnik's factories, Sally is taken prisoner by Robotnik and Snively, who construct a roboti-sized "Sally" clone, complete with Sally's personality, and mannerisms. The double tricks Sonic into rescuing "Sally".

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Eli doesn't believe in ghosts - until he enters Deadweed cavern! But it turns out Eli's first instinct was right. What lurks inside Deadweed is far more evil than ghosts, its El Diablus Nacho, after a supply of the dangerous Dark Water that Dr. Blakk uses to turn innocent slugs into Ghouls.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: A short cut takes the Shane Gang through the territory of the Shadow Clan - and try as they might not to, they are discovered and captured by the mysterious creatures. Just when it looks like our heroes are done for, they are helped out of this jam by a most unlikely savior.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Pronto is thrown in jail on trumped-up charges by a corrupt judge, and the only chance to break him out is Eli making a one-in-a-million trick shot. Only one slinger in all of Slugterra can help Eli make a shot like that - Mario Bravado. Finding the formerly-great-but-now-washed-up Mario is easy. Getting him to help is something else entirely.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Long thought to be merely a legend, an Enigmo Slug has finally been spotted. The bidding is high for this rarest of all slugs, and so is the competition to be the first grab it! Eli and the gang actually beat Slugterra's most vicious slug hunter to the prize-only to find that the hunter is now hunting them!

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: After a wild ride on the mysterious Flumes - the Underriver that runs beneath all of Slugterra - the Shane gang find themselves dropped into a sea cavern.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: A fun trip to the mall cavern turns un-deadly when the place is over run by the zombie-like victims of the Zombus slug. With Pronto zombified (not entirely a bad thing, the others kind of like this new, quieter, more monosyllabic Pronto), the rest of the Shane Gang must find the mysterious Mr. Saturday who controls the Zombus slugs-and find a way to stop him.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: The four members of the Shane Gang think they've found the fifth in Twist, a street-smart kid who volunteers his help when the gang needs it most on a mission gone wrong. But Twist harbors a dark secret that could doom the mission - and the Shane Gang.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: The four members of the Shane Gang think they've found the fifth in Twist, a street-smart kid who volunteers his help when the gang needs it most on a mission gone wrong. But Twist harbors a dark secret that could doom the mission - and the Shane Gang.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Avalanched inside a frozen cavern, the Shane Gang can't figure out which is worse: being trapped with a vicious Ice Ogre that only gets bigger the more you shoot it?

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: A thief breaks into the Shane Gang HQ looking for the fabled "Shane Treasure" - a portion of which she believes belongs to her. The thief escapes with nothing, but Eli does manage to find a treasure chest. To unlock it, the thief and the gang will need to travel to a remote, dangerous cavern to find a special slug. The journey is fraught with peril, and when they finally open the box, what's inside is not at all what they were expecting...

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Notorious con man Gar Rivelle has many convinced he has discovered the way to a secret land... a land that seems to be the surface! Eli uncovers the truth - Gar is getting his information from a coded Shane diary. Keeping the surface secret is Eli's number one mission, so he steals the diary from Gar, sparking an all-out siege on the Shane HQ. Eli realizes that for him to continue in Slugterra, he's going to have to confide his greatest secret to his friends.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Eli fires slugs right and left during a fast-paced slugout on mecha-back! "See you back home," Eli tells the slugs he has to leave behind as he races across a cavern during the fight. The battle won, the Shane Gang is on its way back home when Eli runs into a situation that he can't ignore. One thing leads to another and Eli ends up challenged to a duel. Only one problem, Eli's doesn't have Burpy or the rest of his best slugs! They're still on the way back home!

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: Driven by his intense slug phobia, scientist Quentin Kozinski has invented mechanical slugs. Armed with this fearsome arsenal, he sets out to prove that science can beat any slug and any slinger including the Shane Gang! But Eli is determined to prove that no thinking, living thing can ever be bested by a machine.

programme.title: Slugterra
programme.desc: A mysterious slugslinging master appears for the first time in 20 years. Though old, this slinger is an amazing battler incredibly fast and the master of an unstoppable slinging technique. Eli, Kord, Trixie and Pronto all want to study with the master and learn this awesome move. But so does Dr. Blakk's protégé Twist! Now Eli must face off against Twist and prevent the master from choosing a villain for a student.

programme.title: Blippi Visits Rhythm Discovery Center
programme.desc: Make music with Blippi in this episode on percussion.

programme.title: High Tech Drama
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry's fashion podcast is saved by Apple, then almost sabotaged by Sweet and Sour when Lemon's "mood hair" runs amok, acting like the bickering twins, and the twins' comical argument is accidentally broadcast on the "berrynet."

programme.title: A Berry Merry Birthday
programme.desc: When Sour wishes she could have a birthday all her very own, her twin sister Sweet grants her wish by forgoing celebrating her birthday. But what begins as a day that Sour has always dreamed of quickly becomes a disappointment when she misses her twin. With Strawberry's help, Sour gives her birthday back to Sweet with a special surprise.

programme.title: The Magic Rainbow -Winx Club
programme.desc: As an important ball is taking place at Domino Castle, Kalshara and Brafilius are at Graynor Ruins to catch the Creature with the Rainbow Coat, in order to absorb its magic power. However, Kalshara's attempt fails, unleashing chaos between Wild Magic and Fairy magic, making the colours of Magix big rainbow blur into each other. Warned by Roxy, the Winx and their Fairy Animals enter the Rainbow MiniWorld: Musa and Critty manage to restore the balance of that magic place, thanks to their special magic sensitivity. In order to thank the Winx, the Creature with the Rainbow Coat reveals the Winx (being spied upon by Kalshara and Brafilius) that the Animal with the Ultimate Power is strictly linked to the fairies' power.

programme.title: Baby Winx -Winx Club
programme.desc: Kalshara e Brafilius think that the Animal with the Ultimate Power is one of the Fairy Animals bonded with the Winx. After setting a trap to the six fairies, Brafilius casts a time-reversal spell on their Stones of Memories, making the Winx turn back into little girls. As the Specialists, seeing them, mistake them for young tourists of the Animal Rescue Park, Kalshara easily catches their Fairy Animals… except for Bloom's unicorn. Despite the fact they are only little girls, the Winx manage to send away Brafilius with their magic, creating a funny circus show, and Elas attacks Kalshara, convincing her to leave. Bloom's unicorn, with his power, finally manages to make the Winx turn back to normal.

programme.title: Tall Tale Trio
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: Berry Big Tale-Teller
programme.desc: At the girls' campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the "Berry Deep Dark Forest." She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sour's over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sour's story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: Foods that start with Q
programme.desc: Can you name a food that starts with Q? Avery makes Quiche with Chef Jean-Jacques Texier. Lily visits a sheep farm to find out about a creamy, little known cheese called Quark. Back in the kitchen, they take on Matt's Quirky Quesadilla challenge.

programme.title: Foods for The Brain
programme.desc: Lily knows the smartest way to start the day is with a good breakfast, and meets Chef Donna Dooher to make Green Eggs and Ham. Avery visits a centre that researches fish. Matt keeps score as the two face-off with blueberry and strawberry deserts that help build brain power.

programme.title: On with the show, Percival Learns to Dance, Hide & Seek
programme.desc: EP22: Tijinou and Tijibelle arrive in Wonderland, welcomed by the princess and the Knight.EP23: oom! Boom! Boom! The ground shakes a little in the World of Enchantment : it's Percival the dragon who tries to learn how to dance with a balloonEP24: The princess is playing hide-and-seek and asks Tijinou and Tijibelle to help her find the Fearless Knight, and Percival the dragon.

programme.title: Percival makes a Present, A Surprise for Percival, A Day at The Circus
programme.desc: EP25: When Tijinou and Tijibelle arrive in Wonderland, they find Percival who has an idea for his mum's birthday: he wants to offer her a pearl necklace.EP26: Tijinou and Tijibelle meet the Fearless Knight. He brings a huge basket to the princess, because she is organising a surprise for Percival, the dragon.EP27: The puppy Hot Dog, Percival the dragon and Super Hero are plotting something with Rigolini the clown when Tijinou and Tijibelle arrive in Wonderland.

programme.title: It's A Crazy, Crazy World
programme.desc: The Winx decide to go back to Alfea with their Fairy Animals: in order to catch them, Kalshara has to find a way to enter the school for fairies. But, suddenly, the Winx are called by Roxy for an emergency: the weather in Ethiopia has gone crazy, threatening the cranes that migrated over there. Together with the Pixies, the six fairies get to Ethiopia, but then they have to use their Tynix power to enter the Sundial MiniWorld and sort things out. Before going back home, the Winx find a little Digmole that says it's searching for its own fairy, Faragonda!

programme.title: The Kingdom Of Diamonds -Winx Club
programme.desc: The Digmole the Winx show to Faragonda says it's bonded with the Alfea headmistress, but Faragonda has vague memories about it. Bloom explains that this could be due to the fact that the previous headmistress, Mavilla, cancelled all the memories of the Alfea fairies about the Fairy Animals. As they are speaking, Bloom has an intuition: she realizes that the animal with the First Colour of the Universe is the small statue representing a Digmole taken by Faragonda in the past as it is made of diamond, it reflects all the colours of light. The Winx shrink to enter the Adamantine MiniWorld and there they find a diamond that has the Ultimate Power, but a sudden collapse of the orchard-greenhouse buries Flora under a pile of rocks…

programme.title: Blippi Visits Kennedy Space Center
programme.desc: Blippi visits the Kennedy Space Center and learns about space!

programme.title: The Berry Bitty Great Race
programme.desc: Apple isn't paying attention when Strawberry describes their campout tradition of telling "Tall Tales." So Apple tells her thrilling adventure of a wild road rally she entered, only to surprise the girls by proving the story is actually true.

programme.title: Innovation, Citizenship and Enthusiasm
programme.desc: "We will begin this episode with the visit of Ollie, the oropendola bird, to talk to us about Innovation, which is when our curiosity or need leads us to find new solutions and challenges. Then Ecco the Eagle will tell us how important is the meaning of citizenship, which is about the relationship we have with the members of the community in which we live. First with our neighborhood, and then with our city and country. It is also about complying with rules and regulations for community harmony.

programme.title: Knowledge, Equality and Full Care
programme.desc: "We will begin this episode with Wolfgang the wolf, who will tell us an interesting story about knowledge, teaching us that discovering new things and learning constantly is a magnificent quality of any living being. Then he visits us from La Mancha, Gulcinea la cabra, to talk to us about the equality that is a right that all living beings have. And it is based on the principle that we are all equal. No one is better than another.

programme.title: Naughty Nuts
programme.desc: Nut City, a troublesome cartoon place to live, where major mayhem occurs. It was once a spectacular city full of kids and family, but now isolated due to a surge in crime.

programme.title: Skull of the Black Raven
programme.desc: Gomez is shanghaied by Ghost Pirate Redbeard in the mistaken belief he can help locate the lost Skull of the Black Raven, which will grant Redbeard the power to control minds. Matt and Roxie to the rescue!

programme.title: The Rise of the Mummy
programme.desc: Tenoroc unleashes the Mummy, with orders to find the Eye of Ra and burn the Sea of Sands to a cinder. Matt, Roxie, Gomez and a flatulent camel called Priscilla are all that stand between him and catastrophe!

programme.title: We Are Children Part 1
programme.desc: We hear back from our Ubongo Kids audience!

programme.title: The Mosquito Army
programme.desc: A mosquito army is threatening the village of Kokotoa. Kiduchu is determined to get to the bottom of the problem and help the villagers protect themselves from Malaria.

programme.title: LOL Block
programme.desc: A crazy collection of hilarious comedy series featuring shows like, Elvis and Benny, Eliot Kid, Angelo Rules, and, Kung Food!

programme.title: Eliot Kid
programme.desc: When a tooth falling out turns into a hunt for the “giant mouse”, when the city's sewers transform into Indiana Jones' white rapids or when a trip to the toilets becomes an expedition to a haunted house, well then you've entered the wonderful world of Eliot Kid!

programme.title: Eddie's Wonderland
programme.desc: Festive programming to enjoy the holidays from Eddie's Wonderland!

programme.title: Talking Tom and Friends
programme.desc: Things get even more epic in Season 3 as Talking Tom and Friends try new ways to make their dreams come true, making more friends (and enemies) along the way!

programme.title: Sonic X
programme.desc: A slight malfunction causes Chaos Control, and sends Sonic the Hedgehog to Earth. While there, Sonic meets Chris Thorndyke, who helps in collecting the Chaos Emeralds, so Sonic and friends can go home.

programme.title: Future Card Buddyfight
programme.desc: It is the year 2030, and the stage is the capital of Japan, Chou-Tokyo. Through "Buddyfight", humans have started cultural interactions with residents from other worlds called "Affinity Dimensions". Buddyfight is a game with selected humans as the "Buddyfighter", and residents from the other world as the partner (known as "Buddy Monster"). These battles have high significance and sometimes it is even used to decide the fate of a nation, and naturally there are those who seek to use the Buddy Monsters for evil purposes.

programme.title: I'll Get You! Holiday
programme.desc: The action takes place in all year round resort, where Wolf doesn't chase Hare to eat him anymore: now it's all about sports and competition. However, in his crazy chase after recognition and victories the grey hooligan often uses methods that aren't really fair, which provokes awkward and funny situations.

programme.title: Bat Pat
programme.desc: The series follows the comedy adventures of Bat Pat and the Silver brothers Martin, Leo and Rebecca as they unravel mysteries and cross paths with supernatural creatures of the night that lurk, haunt, shriek and dig themselves up in every dark corner of their home in Fogville, a small town that seems to be the center of all things weird in the world, a veritable magnet to ghosts, mummies, witches, creatures, werewolves and things that go bump in the night. Bat Pat will prove that the supernatural isn't always evil but just misunderstood. Our heroes will come to understand something important: the supernatural “bad guys” are not really bad, but normal people whose actions are misunderstood by the more inhabitants of Fogville and what they really want is... just help!

programme.title: Pumpkin Reports
programme.desc: Max Green's new brother and sister are aliens sent to Earth as the advance party for an invasion - and he's the only one who can stop them turning humans into unwilling slave-gardeners.

programme.title: TOBOT
programme.desc: Ryan and Kory are twin brothers with one big secret: They're Tobot pilots.

programme.title: Roger
programme.desc: The lively adventures of a little girl, the carefree, joyful and occasionally perky Fatou, and an alien, the clumsy Roger, on a tropical island… Throughout their adventures, they trigger small accidents that sometimes grow into major disasters, but (almost) always end on a happy note. In short, Roger and Fatou spend their time saving the island from their own mistakes and blunders.

programme.title: Kongsuni and Friends
programme.desc: For five-year-old Kongsuni life is one big adventure. Whether it's at home, in school, or on the playground.

programme.title: Back to Back
programme.desc: Embark on an electrifying journey as they boldly leap from one heart-pounding expedition to the next, fueled by their unbreakable bond and insatiable thirst for excitement. Get ready to be swept away in a whirlwind of adrenaline-pumping quests, where danger and discovery await them at every turn.

programme.title: Spookley the Square Pumpkin
programme.desc: Holiday shows, music videos, and more featuring everyone's favorite square pumpkin, SPOOKLEY, and his friends from HOLIDAY HILL FARM.

programme.title: Timmy Time
programme.desc: Being an ‘only lamb in the flock' Timmy has been used to getting his own way. Now for the first time Timmy is going to have to learn to get along with other little animals. Timmy is going to Nursery! Self-willed and naughty Timmy is going to have to learn how to share things with other youngsters and think about their feelings – not just his. Timmy is a gifted little footballer who needs to learn that it's not enough to kick the ball – you have to pass it too. Harriet Heron and Osbourne Owl, who run the Nursery are going to have their hands full, but Timmy gets it right in the end with a little help from his friends of the furry, feathery and spikey type.

programme.title: Helper Car
programme.desc: Cartoon for kids about helper cars: a fire truck, an ambulance, a police car and a tow truck. Why these cars and trucks are useful? Because they help people and other cars: fire truck can put out fire, ambulance helps people, when they are hurt or sick, it could drive them to the hospital. Police car patrols the city. Tow truck help other cars, when they are broken down. Watch new car cartoon and learn about helper cars!

programme.title: Counting With Paula
programme.desc: The show features Paula and her friends, Tim, Billy, Chalky, Calc, and the Numbers as they go on exciting adventures in colorful and exotic places. From the Amazon jungles to the deepest oceans, and to the hottest deserts, Paula and friends solve problems, have fun and make more friends along the way!

programme.title: Horaci the Inuit
programme.desc: Packed with adventure, fun and excitement, HORACI THE INUIT will transport you to the Lands of the North where, together with his best friend Sedna, he will have to solve all kinds of mysteries! Horaci the Inuit takes place in a remote village and talks about universal values such as caring for nature, being intuitive and open-minded and, above all, having a loving respect for family and friends!

programme.title: Hogie the Globehopper
programme.desc: Hogie the Globehopper is a fun tv show that will inspire a curiosity and fascination about the world and its people. Hogie and his friends Lorna, Bernie and Floaty travel the world, making lots of friends along the way.

programme.title: Roger
programme.desc: The lively adventures of a little girl, the carefree, joyful and occasionally perky Fatou, and an alien, the clumsy Roger, on a tropical island… Throughout their adventures, they trigger small accidents that sometimes grow into major disasters, but (almost) always end on a happy note. In short, Roger and Fatou spend their time saving the island from their own mistakes and blunders.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo the Wildlife Ranger introduces the secrets and wonders of nature and wildlife around us and kickstarts a curiosity and passion for nature in kids. With engaging missions and adventures, kids have fun while learning positive lessons!

programme.title: Robocar POLI
programme.desc: The courageous and swift police car POLI, the powerful fire engine ROY, the intelligent AMBER, and the flying HELLY are all here to save the day!

programme.title: Pim & Pom at the Museum
programme.desc: Pim & Pom at the Museum: a preschool 2D animated series based on world famous works of art. Pim and Pom, two little cats, take the children on an adventure in the fascinating world of art. Featured artists include Seurat, Renoir and Malevitsch, Rembrandt, Vermeer and Van Gogh. Through the power of their imagination, they explore paintings by famous artists like Vincent van Gogh, Johannes Vermeer, Rembrandt, Seurat and Renoir. The paintings form the backdrop for all their adventures as these curious little cats (literally) dive into a different artwork in each episode. The animation series will be a first introduction to the visual arts for young children.

programme.title: Rainbow Ruby
programme.desc: In Rainbow Village, people are busy preparing for a dance marathon, a competition in which all of the villagers participate. Ling Ling is very sad that Ellie decided not to participate. programme.title: Rainbow Ruby

Rainbow Ruby uses her magic suitcase to transform into a babysitter and starts babysitting the children.

programme.title: Rainbow Ruby
programme.desc: Princess Kiki is asleep, UP IN THE AIR! programme.title: Rainbow Ruby

programme.title: Rainbow Ruby

programme.title: Rev and Roll
programme.desc: When Rev and Avery find a stray kitten, they put posters around to alert its owner. The owner arrives at the Gear Up Garage...just as the kitty vanishes! programme.title: Rev and Roll
programme.desc: Rev and Rumble teach Bentley the puppy to play Hide and Seek! At first the pup doesn't get it...but soon Bentley's hiding so well, they can't find him! programme.title: Rev and Roll

programme.desc: When Rev asks to help beautify the town, he insists there's no job too tough! That is...until he finds out he'll be hauling stinky manure. After hiding Rev's gifts in a tree, they realize the presents are stuck up there and will need to be retrieved-all before Rev figures out what's going on!

programme.title: Rev and Roll

programme.title: Rev and Roll

programme.desc: Rev and the gang are painting a mural for Four-Wheeled Friendship Day! But with Avery in charge, the friends start to lose confidence in their work. programme.title: Rev and Roll
programme.desc: When Rev finds out that Bo wants to be a Police Kid, he tells a white lie to make him one for a day! Officer Bo takes the new job too far, ticketing everyone-for everything. programme.desc: Rev hears a snowstorm is coming, he starts building the best winter track ever! One problem...Rev is sick. No matter what his friends say, they can't keep him away. programme.title: Jamie Lissow
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Jamie Lissow is best known for his role in the current Netflix Original Series Real Rob, alongside SNL alum Rob Schneider, a show Jamie co-wrote and co-produced. Jamie made his network television debut on The Tonight Show and has since appeared on The Late Late Show, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central's Premium Blend, Gotham Live, Star Search, and his own half-hour Comedy Central special. A headliner at comedy clubs across the country, he's also been featured at The Montreal Comedy Festival and The Great American Comedy Festival. Lissow has appeared on Fox News Redeye more than 50 times while still managing to have no political opinions.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy
programme.desc: Leanne Morgan exudes southern charm. She is a naturally funny storyteller who gives an honest look at suburban life and the challenges of keeping her husband happy while juggling kids, dogs and cheerleading camp at the same time she's racing to get her hair highlighted, have a colonoscopy and join weight watchers for the 7th time! Leanne will take you on a hilarious journey through motherhood and beyond as she finds comedy amidst the chaos.

programme.title: Collin Moulton
programme.desc: Collin is one of the most fun, personable, and sought after headliners today. He has had his own stand-up special on SHOWTIME, he's been on NICKELODEON, and was recently featured on LAST CALL WITH CARSON DALY. Touring for over 15 years Collin has gained an ease and enjoyment on stage that makes every show worth watching.America knows and loves him. His familiarity and energy engages and relieves the audience before he even speaks. His electric storytelling style makes you care about every topic he explores. Collin's comedy is the release needed from our every day lives. Come needing to laugh tonight, leave wanting to laugh forever!Collin Moulton

programme.desc: Rik Roberts brings a little bit of Nashville everywhere he goes. From quick bits about family and technology, to surprising stories about marriage and music – you'll find something you can relate to. Growing up in Kentucky, he got his hands dirty working

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy
programme.desc: Tony Deyo is a stand-up comedian known most notably for his sharp, quick material and near-perfect comedic timing almost certainly gained from his years as a professional symphony musician. New York City's Village Voice calls him “one of the tightest joke writers in the business.” In 2013, he made his late night television debut on CONAN. Within a year, he had added appearances on The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson, AXS TV's Gotham Comedy Live, and Comics Unleashed with Byron Allen. His latest album, Comedy Road Trip, landed on the Billboard Magazine comedy chart and debuted as the #1 selling stand-up album on iTunes. With over 50 stand-up clips available, he has steadily become one of the most prolific comedians on YouTube. He performed at the prestigious HBO Aspen Comedy Festival, was named one of the year's best by the New York Post, and can be heard regularly on SiriusXM Satellite Radio.
